text: my unpopular opinion is that in
technology a huge number of technical
decisions are either made or not
objected to out of a fear of looking
dumb so someone comes in with an
architecture World decision or some code
decision or whatever and it's crazy you
know and there's a bunch of engineers in
there looking at it going man that looks
crazy to me but if I say so I'm going to
look dumb I'm gonna look like I'm not
smart enough to understand what they're
doing and so I'm going to keep quiet
about it and uh I think that that is a
problem in general in technology and
it's understandable because it is a
pretty brutal industry we rely on our
intellect quite a bit and there's this
you know there's ageism and you know if
you if you come across as not being
intelligent it can be really detrimental
to your career but I think that
unfortunately it uh ends up in a lot of
situations leading to bad architectural
outcomes and bad code outcomes because
people are unwilling to say this is too
crazy let's do it a simpler way if at
all possible so that's kind of that's my
that's my unpopular opinion yeah the
fear of of looking dumb ends up driving
a lot of technical decisions
[Music]
